titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peter Wellington Alexander Papers,
titlestmt.author: Columbia University Libraries. Rare Book and Manuscript Library; machine readable finding aid created by Columbia University Libraries Digital Library Program Division

publicationstmt.publisher:
Rare Book and Manuscript Library
Columbia University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Machine readable finding aid generated from MARC-AMC source via XSLT conversion March 25, 2009

change.item: xml document instance created by Carrie Hintz

did.unittitle: Peter Wellington Alexander Papers,

physdesc.extent: 10 linear feet (18 document boxes and 12 flat boxes).
16 reels of microfilm (8 positive reels-2 copies of reels 1-3 & 5-7); 8 master negative reels).

repository.corpname: Columbia University.Rare Book and Manuscript Library,

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Colonel Peter Wellington Alexander, Confederate States of America, Georgia-born editor and Civil War correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of over four hundred letters to Alexander, as well as miscellaneous letters and telegrams; business and military documents; and copybooks and letter books; and complete and partial newspapers and clippings from the various Southern newspapers with which he was affiliated, in particular The Savannah Republican and the Advertiser and Register of Mobile, which carried Alexander's dispatches.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Collection is arranged into 5 series:
Cataloged Correspondence
Arranged Series
Correspondence
Telegrams
Manuscripts & Documents
Copybooks, Letterbooks, etc.
Miscellaneous Documents
Orders
Reports
Southern United States Newspspers
Printed Documents & Books
Addition (1976)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of specific item; Date (if known); Peter Wellignton Alexander Papers, 1855-1863; Box and Folder; Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Columbia University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection, processed by MAry Boone Bowling, December, 1974

otherfindaid.p: Guide to the materials on microfilm, 1 volume, in repository.

relatedmaterial.head: Selected Related Material

p.extref: Community & Conflict: The Impact of the Civil War in the Ozarks

relatedmaterial.p: This online exhibition includes a large amount of dogitized material from the Columbia University Collection
